triples.name: Helicopter
triples.relevance: Helicopters are a foundational aerial platform discussed as one of the key aerial robotic systems analyzed in the survey.

triples.name: Multirotor
triples.relevance: Multirotors are a primary class of conventional underactuated aerial platforms that are central to the survey's analysis of aerial robotic manipulators.

triples.name: Manipulator (device)
triples.relevance: Robotic manipulators are the core enabling technology for aerial robots to physically interact with the environment as discussed throughout the survey.

triples.name: Aerial robotics
triples.relevance: Aerial robotics encompasses the field being surveyed, which analyzes the evolution and trends in this research area.

triples.name: Teleoperation
triples.relevance: Teleoperation is identified as a key development area in aerial robotic manipulation covered by the survey.

triples.name: Motion planning
triples.relevance: Motion planning is one of the three major developments (alongside perception) covered in the planning section of the survey.

triples.name: Computer vision
triples.relevance: Computer vision provides perception capabilities essential for autonomous aerial robotic manipulation as discussed in the survey.

triples.name: Swarm robotics
triples.relevance: Swarm robotics relates to the cooperative aerial manipulation discussed as an important development area in the survey.
